Abstract: Peter Marks analysis finds that commercials run in presidential campaign so far are remarkably tame, the candidates apparently unwilling to be the first to 'go negative' (M)
Snippet: Peter Marks analysis finds that commercials run in presidential campaign so far are remarkably tame, the candidates apparently unwilling to be the first to 'go negative' (M)
LeadParagraph: In a new commercial running in early primary states this week, Gov. George W. Bush comes out squarely in favor of phonics. ''See,'' he explains, ''I believe every child can learn.''

Headline.Main: In Ads, Candidates' Gloves Stay On
Headline.PrintHeadline: In Ads, Candidates' Gloves Stay On
